page.title: 04EDUCATION IN TILSTON
page.content: Education is provided by the state for all children between the ages of 5 and 16. The majority of children between the ages of 5 and 11 attend{Tilston {C.E.(controlled) Primary School}and those of secondary school age attend {Bishop Heber High School, Malpas. Transport is provided for children who live further than three miles from their nearest school, so most secondary age children in the area travel to school by coach. A small number of children (about 9%) attend{private schools}in Chester or Whitchurch. For instance Kings school for boys and Queens school for girls, both in Chester, accept children by selection. There is a {community playgroup. Higher education is provided in Chester. The primary school population in 1985 is 54.
